content.text: In LC's work to dance with her is something like political maneuvering. You don't have power over her, or even a steady relationship with her, but at least you're in the game. For two examples see The Future, which proclaims that as the West unravels we will see "the white man dancing", or the single Do I Have to Dance All Night

It's a consistent theme in LC's work that this time is "the darkness, the flood"; the love affair of the last centuries is ending, being swept away. A good reference for this is Closing Time, though there are many others.
